title: C08-2010

sentences.text: Language resource quality is crucial in NLP .
Many of the resources used are derived from data created by human beings out of an NLP context , especially regarding MT and reference translations .
Indeed , automatic evaluations need high-quality data that allow the comparison of both automatic and human translations .
The validation of these resources is widely recommended before being used .
This paper describes the impact of using different-quality references on evaluation .
Surprisingly enough , similar scores are obtained in many cases regardless of the quality .
Thus , the limitations of the automatic metrics used within MT are also discussed in this regard .

Entity-language_resource_quality.label: Language resource quality
Entity-language_resource_quality.description: Language resource quality refers to the assessment and validation of the quality of linguistic resources used in natural language processing (NLP), which is essential for ensuring accurate evaluations in tasks such as machine translation.

Entity-the_impact_of_using_different-qua.label: the impact of using different-quality references
aliases: the impact of using different-quality references
Entity-the_impact_of_using_different-qua.description: The impact of using different-quality references refers to the effects that varying levels of reference data quality have on the evaluation outcomes in natural language processing, particularly in machine translation, highlighting that similar evaluation scores can be achieved despite differences in reference quality.

mentions.local_name: the impact of using different-quality references

Entity-resource.label: resources
Entity-resource.description: The term 'resources' refers to language resources, which are data and materials derived from human-created content used in natural language processing (NLP) for tasks such as machine translation (MT) and evaluation of translation quality.

Entity-different-quality_reference.label: different-quality references
Entity-different-quality_reference.description: Different-quality references refer to the varying levels of quality in reference data used for evaluating machine translation systems, which can significantly influence the outcomes of automatic evaluations.

Entity-limitation_of_the_automatic_metri.label: limitations of the automatic metrics
aliases: the limitations of the automatic metrics
Entity-limitation_of_the_automatic_metri.description: The limitations of the automatic metrics refer to the shortcomings and challenges associated with using automated evaluation methods in assessing the quality of machine translation outputs.

mentions.local_name: the limitations of the automatic metrics

Entity-automatic_metric.label: automatic metrics
Entity-automatic_metric.description: Automatic metrics are quantitative evaluation methods used to assess the performance of natural language processing systems, particularly in tasks like machine translation.

Entity-automatic_evaluation.label: automatic evaluations
Entity-automatic_evaluation.description: Automatic evaluations refer to assessment methods in natural language processing that utilize high-quality data to compare the performance of automatic translation systems against human translations.

Entity-reference_translation.label: reference translations
Entity-reference_translation.description: Reference translations are high-quality translation data created by humans, used as a benchmark for evaluating the performance of machine translation systems.

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper is a research document that examines the effects of varying quality in reference data on the evaluation of machine translation, highlighting the surprising consistency of evaluation scores despite differences in reference quality.

Entity-evaluation.label: evaluation
Entity-evaluation.description: The term 'evaluation' refers to the process of assessing the quality of automatic translations in comparison to human translations, particularly emphasizing the necessity of high-quality data for accurate assessments.

Entity-nlp_context.label: NLP context
Entity-nlp_context.description: NLP context refers to the specific environment or framework in which natural language processing resources and data are generated, particularly in relation to machine translation and reference translations.

Entity-data_created_by_human_being.label: data created by human beings
Entity-data_created_by_human_being.description: Data created by human beings refers to the linguistic resources and information generated by individuals, which are utilized in natural language processing (NLP) tasks, particularly in machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-data.label: data
Entity-data.description: The term 'data' refers to information generated by humans in the context of natural language processing (NLP), particularly related to machine translation (MT) and reference translations.

Entity-similar_score.label: similar scores
Entity-similar_score.description: The term 'similar scores' refers to the comparable evaluation results obtained from different-quality reference translations in the context of automatic metrics used in machine translation.

Entity-validation.label: validation
Entity-validation.description: Validation refers to the process of assessing the quality and reliability of language resources before their use in natural language processing applications.

Entity-human_translation.label: human translations
Entity-human_translation.description: Human translations refer to text or content that has been translated from one language to another by a human translator, as opposed to being generated by automated translation systems.

Entity-comparison_of_both_automatic_and_.label: comparison of both automatic and human translations
aliases: comparison of both automatic and human translations
Entity-comparison_of_both_automatic_and_.description: An analysis that evaluates the differences and similarities between translations produced by automated systems and those created by human translators.

mentions.local_name: comparison of both automatic and human translations

Entity-mt.label: MT
Entity-mt.description: MT refers to machine translation, a subfield of natural language processing that focuses on the automatic translation of text or speech from one language to another.

Entity-nlp.label: NLP
Entity-nlp.description: NLP refers to the field of study known as natural language processing, which focuses on the interaction between computers and human language.

Entity-high-quality_data.label: high-quality data
Entity-high-quality_data.description: High-quality data refers to data that is accurate, reliable, and relevant, ensuring that it meets the necessary standards for effective analysis and evaluation.

Entity-reference.label: references
Entity-reference.description: References are sources or citations used to support claims or provide evidence in academic and scholarly work.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written document that presents research findings, analyses, or arguments, typically in an academic or scholarly context.

Entity-human_being.label: human beings
Entity-human_being.description: Human beings are members of the species Homo sapiens, characterized by their capacity for complex thought, language, and social interaction.

summary: Language resource quality is crucial in NLP . Many of the resources used are derived from data created by human beings out of an NLP context , especially regarding MT and reference translations . Indeed , automatic evaluations need high-quality data that allow the comparison of both automatic and human translations . The validation of these resources is widely recommended before being used . This paper describes the impact of using different-quality references on evaluation . Surprisingly enough , similar scores are obtained in many cases regardless of the quality . Thus , the limitations of the automatic metrics used within MT are also discussed in this regard .

Predicate-is_crucial_in.label: is crucial in
Predicate-is_crucial_in.description: The predicate 'is crucial in' indicates that the subject plays a significant and essential role in the context of the object. It suggests that the subject is a key factor or component that contributes to the effectiveness, success, or overall importance of the object within a particular domain or field.

Predicate-are_derived_from.label: are derived from
Predicate-are_derived_from.description: The predicate 'are derived from' indicates a relationship where the subject is produced, obtained, or developed as a result of the influence, extraction, or transformation of the object. It signifies a foundational or causal connection, suggesting that the subject's existence or characteristics are contingent upon the object.

Predicate-is_created_by.label: is created by
Predicate-is_created_by.description: The predicate 'is created by' establishes a relationship where the subject is the result of a process or action performed by the object. It indicates that the object, typically a person or group, is the agent responsible for the formation, development, or generation of the subject, highlighting the active role of the creator in bringing the subject into existence.

Predicate-is_derived_from.label: is derived from
Predicate-is_derived_from.description: The predicate 'is derived from' establishes a relationship of origin or source between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject has been formed, developed, or generated based on the principles, concepts, or elements represented by the object. It implies a foundational connection where the object serves as a basis or influence for the subject.

Predicate-is_created_out_of.label: is created out of
Predicate-is_created_out_of.description: The predicate 'is created out of' establishes a relationship where the subject is formed or generated from the components, materials, or influences represented by the object. It indicates that the essence or nature of the subject is derived from the object, highlighting a foundational or originating connection between the two.

Predicate-need.label: need
Predicate-need.description: The predicate 'need' establishes a relationship where the subject requires or depends on the object to fulfill a certain function, achieve a goal, or maintain a state. It indicates that the absence of the object would hinder the subject's effectiveness or capability.

Predicate-allow.label: allow
Predicate-allow.description: The predicate 'allow' indicates that the subject provides the necessary conditions or permissions for the action or process described by the object to take place. It signifies a facilitative relationship where the subject enables or permits the object to occur or be realized.

Predicate-is_recommended_before_being_us.label: is recommended before being used
Predicate-is_recommended_before_being_us.description: The predicate 'is recommended before being used' indicates that the subject should be considered or applied prior to the utilization of the object. This suggests a guideline or best practice that emphasizes the importance of the subject in ensuring the effective or safe application of the object.

Predicate-is_widely_recommended_before_b.label: is widely recommended before being used for
Predicate-is_widely_recommended_before_b.description: The predicate 'is widely recommended before being used for' indicates that the subject is advised or suggested to be utilized in a particular context or application represented by the object. This recommendation implies that there is a consensus or strong belief in the value or necessity of the subject's prior application or consideration before it can be effectively or appropriately employed for the purpose denoted by the object.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates that the subject provides an explanation, account, or representation of the object, conveying information or details about it. This connection implies that the subject offers insights or clarifications regarding the nature, characteristics, or implications of the object.

Predicate-on.label: on
Predicate-on.description: The predicate 'on' indicates a relationship where the subject has a significant influence, effect, or relevance to the object. It suggests that the subject is a factor that can alter, inform, or be associated with the object in some meaningful way.

Predicate-are_discussed_in.label: are discussed in
Predicate-are_discussed_in.description: The predicate 'are discussed in' indicates that the subject is the topic of conversation, analysis, or examination within the context of the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject is explored, explained, or evaluated in the framework provided by the object, suggesting that the object serves as a medium, source, or setting for the discussion.

Predicate-are_discussed_in_regard_to.label: are discussed in regard to
Predicate-are_discussed_in_regard_to.description: The predicate 'are discussed in regard to' indicates that the subject is the focus of a conversation or analysis that pertains to the object. It suggests that the subject is being examined, evaluated, or considered in the context of the object, highlighting a relationship where the subject's characteristics, implications, or relevance are being explored in relation to the object.

Predicate-affects.label: affects
Predicate-affects.description: The predicate 'affects' denotes a relationship in which the subject has an influence or effect on the object. It implies that changes or variations in the subject lead to corresponding changes in the object, indicating a causal or relational connection between the two entities.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or category that falls under the wider classification represented by the object. This relationship is often used in contexts such as taxonomy, ontology, or categorization, where the object encompasses a larger set of concepts or entities that include the subject.
